comments:
Build ID:  M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Appears randomly


More information:

I have dynamic Web project with 2 facets - dynamic Web module and Java.
When I publish this project to Tomcat (in "execute in workspace mode) it sometimes is published partially only) - META-INF and WEB-INF/classes (with appropriates contents). WEB-INF/web.xml and WEB/lib are not published.
Sometimes as well (but not always) XML file (Spring context) from classes directory is not published as well. Restart of Eclipse, removing project from server and republishing do not help.

It seems that publish0.xml in .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\publish is incorrect as well -see attachment.

Regards,
Oleksandr

Created an attachment (id=55907)
Invalid publish0.xml (no lib and web.xml entries)

Created an attachment (id=55908)
Valid publish0.xml, but contextDehn.xml was not published anyway

Valid publish0.xml, but contextDehn.xml was not published anyway.
File to be published is present in build/classes directory of project (where it belongs).

Regards,
Oleksandr

Can you post a sample of your project, or are you willing to take some traces to help diagnose the problem? Once this happens, have you found any way to get it correct again? It actually sounds to me like the project is not configured correctly or does not think those resources are part of the app.

Project was created by wizard with default values whenever possible, no changes to configuration have been made after it. It has worked for a while, then this behavior started to appear (after one of updates). Really, it is present in more then one project and more then one computer.

As you can see from second attached file (publish0_1.xml) even when project recognizes all respective resources not all of them are published. It contains absolutely valid reference to contextDehn.xml, but contextDehn.xml was not publshed.

To push it to work I just copy absent files to destination (.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\DehnCD2NewTW)
and on next publishing they are usually republished correctly). Why I can not explain. Sometimes problem go away by itself, but not often.

Sorry, I can not send project (against company rules), but would take whatever traces you need. Just say which and how.

Here is extract of .log file for last session:

Created an attachment (id=56298)
Debug options file

The stack trace from the .log file looks like a problem, but unrelated to publishing. I've attached a .options file that will hopefully provide enough information to debug the publish. Just detach the file and launch Eclipse using:

  eclipse -debug <path to .options file> -consolelog

This will launch Eclipse with a secondary console window. When you hit the publishing problem, please attach the console here (or the last hundred or so lines if it took a while to reproduce) and double-check the .log for any new errors.

Thank you, will give it a try, but for last few days I have experienced no publishing problem, so it may take a while. BTW, I alway run Eclipse with console window (use java.exe instead of javaw.exe).

Created an attachment (id=56333)
Better debug options file

Sorry, realized that the .options file was missing a couple lines. Please use this new copy instead.

So here is console output from partial publishing (web.xml was not published, while present in the publish0.xml):

Unfortunately the beginning of the file copying is lost off the top of the trace. Can you please increase the buffer for your console and try again? It would also help with the formatting if you can increase the console width a bit and paste it into a text file and attach it instead of pasting the contents.

Is this the first time the module was added to the server, or is this a subsequent publish? After the first time it only publishes changed files, so if this is not the first publish I'd need to know if the file was published successfully the first time and if you can tell when the file is being deleted (or who/what is doing the deletion).

You have asked for "one hundred or so lines", I have set buffer for 300 and you say that it is not enough :( How many you need? 500? 1000? 10000?
Concerning the width and attachment - no problem, would do it.

It was complete republishing - server was stopped, right-closked in "server" view. Item  "Add and remove Projects" selected and project removed, then server started and project published (causing server restart). No manual intervention.

Regards, 
Oleksandr

So, now the same situation with the same scenario - project was removed from server with "Add and remove projects ..." menu item, server started and project published. web.xml against lost in space. publish0.xml is the same,so I do not attach it, but console log is attached.

Just interesting moment - Eclipse was installed today from scratch (Eclipse SDK 3.2.1 installed into the new directory and then all needed updates downloaded from update sites in one shot).

Regards,

Hello,

next incarnation of the same issue - not complete republishing of the project after some code modifications. This time contextDehn.xml file has disappeared.
It was properly published before, then, after some Java-code was edited (but not this file!) "Run as/Run on server" was executed resulting into "java.io.FileNotFoundException: class path resource [contextDehn.xml] cannot be opened because it does not exist". And it really does not exists in the .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\DehnCD2NewTW\WEB-INF\classes\. All class files as well as propery files are Ok.
